overview_of_class: Through presentations, discussions, field trips, and technical demonstrations, we will explore the current state of sound design for museum exhibitions. As a final project, students will create a fully-realized sound design for the exhibition Faces of Roman Egypt: Mummy Portraits from Ancient Tebtunis, an exhibition planned for Northwestern's Block Museum of Art from January to April of 2018. This project will be supported throughout the quarter by presentations from the curator and contributing scholars to the exhibition, a tour of the exhibition space, and a review of the available sound technology used in the museum.
name: Topics in Sound
title: SoC RTVF 373-0-20 Topics in Sound
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-req: Students must be RTVF Majors and have taken and passed RTVF 190 with a C- or better to register for this course.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Through presentations, discussions, field trips, and technical demonstrations, we will explore the current state of sound design for museum exhibitions. As a final project, students will create a fully-realized sound design for the exhibition Faces of Roman Egypt: Mummy Portraits from Ancient Tebtunis, an exhibition planned for Northwestern's Block Museum of Art from January to April of 2018. This project will be supported throughout the quarter by presentations from the curator and contributing scholars to the exhibition, a tour of the exhibition space, and a review of the available sound technology used in the museum.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisites: RTVF 383 & RTVF 384, enrollment in the SAI program, or instructor permission.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
? To develop a familiarity with the basic strategies and methods of creating sound designs for museum exhibitions
? To learn about common technologies and solutions for fixed and interactive sound distribution within a gallery.
? To gain hands-on experience creating the sound design for an actual exhibition, through conversations with the curator and other interested parties.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Class participation, two or three small projects, one presentation, and a final project.

descriptions.value: Portable hard drive for storing and transporting class-related data. Deposits are required for studio access and equipment checkout. ?
